description:
I was in SF for work, but had a few hours after work one day to meet up with a friend for dinner. He lives around the area, so we walked over to Sakesan from his house. It was a random Thursday night, about 9pm, and the wait was going to be 45 minutes. This place sure is popular! We opted to sit at the bar since there was no wait time.

We ordered three special rolls - Cherry Blossom (salmon & avocado roll topped with tuna & tobiko), Deluxe California Roll (fresh snow crab with mayo, avocado, cucumber & tobiko), and the Kirin Roll (BBQ eel, avocado, tobiko, crab, and unagi sauce on top of a spider roll). Both rolls were really good, but I think I liked the Cherry Blossom the most. The Deluxe California was so-so and I would skip it next time.

We also ordered chicken gizzard robata and deep fried octopus. Both were good, but I'd recommend ordering more robata over the other appetizers. The flavor is really top notch.

We ended up staying for about 2 hours and no one rushed us out at all. They were also able to help us split the bill in the way that we wanted it. Servers were very attentive and super nice.
author: Michelle T.

description:
This is a relatively new Chinese owned JP sushi place. With that said, they are efficient and flexible to accommodate your requests whenever is possible.  If you are looking for a super authenticated JP sushi place, you will be disappointed, and this is NOT a place you will like. However, I personally believe that this restaurant has accumulated enough "casual"sushi lovers to keep this place BUSY !! Therefore, call and make reservation.

Food: 4 out of 5
Variety: 3 out of 5
Price: $$ to $$$
Ambience: 4 out of 5
Service: 5 out of 5
Sake selection: ASK THEM (many are off manual)

Omakase for only $35 is unbeatable !! (8 pieces of nigiri)
author: R L.

description:
Hate to write bad reviews, but I hope this is informative for folks.  We ordered delivery which was quick and easy but the food was really not that good.  We ended up tossing most of it and were really disappointed in the execution of the dishes. 

The tempura was way over battered. For instance, the shrimp had batter extended a half inch on both sides, and some other pieces had so much that you couldn't bite through and get to the veggie. 

The sashimi was fibrous and tough. It was inedible and I had to spit it out.  The rolls didn't taste very fresh.  The gyoza was mushy inside.  The curry tasted ok but was very salty and we were wondering if there might have been msg in it (i.e. the curry blocks).  

Was hoping for something different and more in line with the solid four star reviews here. Feel a little duped by the rating and sorry to say we won't be ordering or visiting this place again.
author: Jesus H.

description:
3.5 stars

The IT child on ocean avenue, or so it seems, based on the extensive wait time. Thankfully, when we showed up it was easy to snag a table for the six of us in the karaoke room

Dollar oyster deal was a good deal especially considering it's not an HH thing

Fried chicken was done well and worth a grab

Sashimi and nigiri was good for the price range 

Hamachi Kama was cooked well but under seasoned

Monkfish liver was ok, wouldn't repeat unless they change their provider

Service was good as they have a table buzzer to get their attention 

Overall thoughts

Not something I wait for but wouldn't shy away either if I was passing by
author: Eddie W.

description:
High 3 stars. For karaoke, the food is great. For a Japanese restaurant, the food is decent. The prices are very reasonable. It's just a ways outside of the city so easiest to reach by car.

There was pretty good selection of English and Asian songs, and the interface was decently easy to use/figure out. Don't be confused that you can't enter spaces - just enter artists/titles without the spaces. The only way to enter songs is by a touch-screen interface at the front of the room, and it's a little hard to crawl over everyone every time you want to enter a song - it was easier to just assign someone to be the one to enter songs at the front of the room.

RESERVATIONS: Karaoke room made for a group of 10 a few weeks in advance.

THE COST: $40 per person for 3 hours of karaoke (more like 3.5 - we stayed until the next group's reservation), after meeting a $250 minimum for food. 

THE FOOD: Various members of our group ordered a lot of food so I don't have details on every dish, but below are the standouts (good or bad).

* Chicken Karaage (Happy Hour $5) - 2.5 stars
Very dry!

* Veggie Croquette - 4 stars

* Beef Sukiyaki - 3.5 stars. Decent sweet broth. 

* Donburi - 3.5 stars. Fresh tasting fish

* Sushi generally - 3.5 stars. Pretty good overall

* Fried banana & ice cream dessert - 2 stars. Fried banana was very flavorless.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I have been racking my brain to find a reason to give this place 4 stars or less but can't think of anything. It is definitely worth its 4.5+ rating.

Walked in and expected it to be crowded being that it was a Saturday around dinner time but we found plenty of seats arriving around 540pm. They have happy hour til 6pm, can't remember from what time but it might be 3pm but don't quote me on it.

The hostess was very pleasant and greeted us right away and took us to our seats. Our wait staff was also VERY pleasant, personable, and great to just strike up a convo with! Constantly coming around asking how we were doing, refilling water, and just being amazing all around.

We ordered off the happy hour menu first of course, hen plenty from the regular menu, pics on here.

The entire meal was a great experience...I should have gotten the waitress' name so I could give her kudos on here but didn't think about it. I haven't had service like that in a while.

I will definitely be going back and I HIGHLY recommend here not just because the food was great but just the friendly atmosphere! I also want to try the "gambler" role where only 1 piece of the role has the ghost pepper in it..who wants to risk it? haha...LOVE it!
author: Austin C.

description:
There seems to be a lot of new restaurants popping up on Ocean Ave, which I'm really excited about because it means more options! My boyfriend loves sushi so we knew we had to try Sakesan.

It was really easy to make a reservation on Yelp. We had to eat at 5:30pm because we made a last minute reservation on a Sunday so I can imagine it might get busy for dinner. 

Everything we got was fresh and delicious. My boyfriend ordered the Thunder Roll and the Negi Hamachi Roll. Good portions and really tasty! I'll let everyone know that the Thunder Roll was decently spicy so beware. I got the Seafood Yosenabe which came with a good amount of actual seafood and the portion size was decent. It came with a side of rice as well. 

The restaurant is very new and modernly decorated. Overall, the staff was very friendly and it was a great experience. So glad a good sushi place opened in this area!
author: Kelly N.

description:
Sakesan in Westwood Park was, in my opinion, as good as it looks.  Its wooden high ceiling interior was truly a high quality.  Reminded me of being in a high end restaurant of Tokyo Metropolitan.  While still looking brand new, it's a perfect time on a Wednesday night with my mom, brother, and I.

Loved the food we ordered together: seafood and chicken curry rice bowls, the Aloha and Phoenix rolls, and the Sake Kama.  The Phoenix roll, which I point out, was a modified version of the spider roll, my favorite roll.  Pieces of deep fried soft shell crab was what I find almost irresistible to my taste.

Hopefully, I may want to come back to try something different next time.  Maybe I would one time try a pair of nigiris, or even a pair of A5 Japanese wagyu (raw beef) for $20.  But for the first time, we paid what we get for on the first night.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I cannot express how glad I am to have this so close to home! This place is incredible, it has such a welcoming vibe. Modern yet touch of authentic.

If you're familiar with the area you know not to expect parking to be easy. Street parking only, for those wondering, but in our experience we didn't have a hard time. 

Made a reservation a day before for an early father's day dinner. I wanted sushi and we haven't had sushi in a while, somewhere not cheap and not over priced, easy to say the prices here are fair. 

Thanks to Yelp, I was able go find this place, read some reviews about this place and thought I'd see for myself.

I have to give it to the staff, they are very accomodating and attentive. Super quick service and I love that.

The place is so cute, we were seated in a slightly secluded area where you have to take your shoes off. That's one of the of the reasons why I also wanted to go here. I have been to the Sakesan Bistro in Clement St in SF, and they have similarities in decor and menu, i enjoyed that place too but since it's a bit further, I'm definitely happy to have this one close by.

Great selection on the menu, we went with the following:
NOTE: Fresh! Everything was good and did not smell fishy.
Half Dozen Oysters (5/5 sweet)
Cherry Blossom roll (5/5)
Inside Out roll (4/5)
Beef wrapped Asparagus (asparagus was tough 3/5)
Lobster Hand roll (5/5)
Spicy Scallop Hand roll (5/5)
Tako Nigiri (4/5)
Salmon Belly Nigiri (i didnt have this)

Definitely ejoyed my experience and will be coming back, this will not be my go to :)
author: Madel R.

description:
Came here for Father's Day. Made a reservation so we could enjoy the happy hour goodies. Sake, beer and wine was only about $3 to $5. We ordered a bunch of HH eats - a dozen oysters - good but very small or shall I say tiny. We also got chicken kaarage, fried baby octopus and fried squid tentacles. All was good. The decor of the restaurant and plating looked so good. We also had seaweed salad - delicious. We ordered the chief's omakase - it cost about $58 and the sliced fish was thick but very small pieces. I didn't think if was worth the money. Except for the salmon, I've had fresher. We ordered a salmon skin hand roll - it was yummy. Then we had the chicken heart and pork belly Robata - pork belly could have been crispier. 

At the recommendation of the waitress, we ordered
A gambler roll where one piece is extremely spicy. My husband got that piece. Haha!  Very timely for Father's Day. It was raw fish in the middle with salmon on top and it came in 8 pieces with a flame in the middle. 

All in all - it was a great experience. We had to take our shoes off to sit at a table which was different. Next Time I'll wear socks!
author: Donna L.

description:
Great new addition to the area! 
When you walk in, you can smell the new wood. I made reservations for myself and the hubby and we were seated promptly in the area where you have to take your shoes off (Thankfully I had on "not socks" cause my toes needed a pedi! LOL) It made the dining experience a bit more fun for us!

Most of our food came out super fast!  However, when we ordered seconds (mainly cooked food) I think our waitress forgot to put the order so we waited extra long. I know they were busy that evening, so it didn't bother us too much. Our experience would have been perfect though if we didn't have that long wait.

Here's what we ordered:

-dozen daily special oysters (which were $1 each)
-tempura roll
-dragon roll
-omakase sashimi : the fish was soooo fresh
-geso karaage (deep fried tenticles)
-Iidako Karaage (deep fried baby octopus): was light on the batter and soft/chewy! Yum!
-jalapeno poppers: I've never had it with salmon, so it was a nice surprise! I would probably order this dish again!

Then we ordered these dishes and they took sooo long to come out:
-robata hotate (scallops with butter): was just ok. The butter seemed watered down, probably because of the scallop "juice"
-gyutan (beef toungue): was easy to eat, the sauce was on the sweeter side. 
-fried chicken skin: didn't have any taste 

And to drink, we had the "Mu" sake. Very fruity and easy to drink!! =)

All the waitresses were very sweet and for the most part provided great service.
author: Mimie L.

description:
Came here on a late weekday night to satisfy some sushi cravings. 

Loved the modern interior design and aesthetics of the restaurant! 

I highly recommend the oysters, which we got half a dozen for $6!! Their deal is all time round and not only happy hour like other restaurants. I was a huge fan of the umami but slightly sweet sauce that was included. 

As for the rolls, we got the 49ers and the Giant rolls. 49er was a bit meh but got the job done. Giant roll was definitely the star out of the two, most likely due to the unagi sauce. I mean who can dislike a touch of unagi sauce on a simple roll of snow crab with salmon! 

Some tiny things that led to the dock of the one star was the initial service we received. When we first entered, the restaurant wasn't busy. However, we were neglected/not acknowledged by the servers for a fair 5-10 minutes even though I'm sure that they saw us waiting. Another no-no in my book is being served lukewarm water... yes, the bottle containing the water looked beautiful but lukewarm water is just a huge question to me... 

Overall, definitely will be back for more oysters in the future and maybe try some of their other dishes.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Wow this place has a very modern decor, especially being on oceans ave where everything isn't as nice, this place definitely stood out. 

Food is pricey imo. Tried a few of sushi rolls, they are smaller portion for what you paid for. Between 2 girls, we ordered 4-5 rolls, which is surprising because I'm usually full with 2-3 rolls to share. So prepare to spend if you come here because portion isn't big.
author: Debbie D.

description:
Oh it was delicious. A place with such ambiance had great food to match and service was impeccable!

Came in time to order off the happy hour menu and the regular menu. 

The exterior of the store is pretty, clean and edgy. I love the way it's looks add to the feel of this ever updating neighborhood.

Parking can be difficult in this residential neighborhood!

The interior of the restaurant is split into three dining experiences - the front consists of 4 tables they call "VIP". Nice tables set up high that require shoe removal to enter (FYI). The second area would be the sushi bar (oohhh ahhh.. the fish looked so fresh in the cases!), and the last section is the regular dining room. The second and third areas are shoe-on zones.

There are at least two large TVs here. Enough to catch a game going on.

We ordered, for two hungry people:

Kaki fry (fried oysters) - perfectly cooked, crispy, hot, flavorful and not overly breaded

Chicken karage (fried chicken pieces) - a little greasy, portion is small

Spicy salmon roll - pretty good!!

Philly roll - good regular ole philly roll!

Dragon roll - your typical eel and avocado topped on shrimp tempura roll. Tasted great 

Hamachi fish Collar - so delicious! A definite favorite under the hot dish menu. Perfectly baked - allow 20-25 min to cook so order this early

Thunder roll- this was my favorite -four types of fresh fish topped on a spicy tuna roll.

Service was great. Portions were good. Things can add up so keep a tab mentally on what you've already ordered :)

We'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!
author: Karen H.

description:
Came here during the soft opening.  Let me tall ya, this place has a great happy hour menu, with most items at $5 from 4pm to 6pm.  We had just missed the HH, but were still able to order the Oysters at only $1 each.  They were small and sweet...yum what a deal.  We  ordered the suki yaki which came with a bowl of rice.  The beef came cooked in a bowl with vermicelli and veggies $15.  The Unagi rice was good at $15, Poki doki was their version of poki on top of a bed of dressed salad which was very refreshing, The anki mo was good served with ponzu sauce.  We also ordered some robata (BBQ) wings, chicken skins and  veg.  They were decent and as expected.

I really liked this place, the interior had high ceilings, wooden panels, modern tatami tables by the windows (have to remove your shoes) They also have a sushi bar counter and two karaoke rooms for private parties. The restrooms are gender neutral to save wait time.  Overall, a modern chic interior, friendly wait staff and great Japanese food. Will definitely return again, hopefully earlier enough to try the HH menu.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
A friend and I checked this place out and ordered these things. Saturday night at 730pm was a 30 min wait. 

1. Spicy tuna tartare tacos (4 stars. Best item we got! Loved how it came with an avocado that paired perfectly with the tuna tartare) 
2. Deep fried baby octopus (4 stars. Also bomb!!)
3. Robata hotate (scallop with garlic butter) (2 stars.. too buttery)
4. Gyutan (beef tongue with citrus soy sauce) (3 stars.. didn't really like the texture haha but that's just personal preference)
5. sukiyaki  (3.5 stars. Delicious sweet broth with beef, veggies, and clear noodles. Wish there was some type of dipping sauce for the beef like other places, only reason why I give it 3.5, but it was pretty good)

Atmosphere - trendy, we took off our shoes for the traditional Japanese feel. 

Service - good 

Overall: unfortunately we ordered the wrong things in the grill/robata, but this place wasn't bad and I would come back to try other items.
author: Raquel Y.

description:
Unfortunately I can't give you a review of a restaurant experience as we decided to Uber eat Sakesan Sushi. 

SOOO here is my Uber eat experience. 

The food was prompt, well packaged, still tasty for not having it right away, and the best part was the sashimi was generous! I loved that the sashimi didn't come in tiny thin unfulfilling pieces. 

I would say it's def worth trying Sakesan sushi if you want something new
author: Raul S.

description:
We went on a Saturday night and the service is atrocious.  It was around 7:30 or 8:00 at night, not full, about four servers available and we were ignored for about 10 minutes while waiting for seating.  We knew the servers all knew we were standing there because they obviously avoided eye contact.  One of the sushi chefs stood behind the counter watching and looking displeased but made no attempt at all to smile at us or to alert the servers.

When we were finally seated, there were no apologies or niceties exchanged.  One of the gross things we noticed, both while waiting to be seated and while seated, was the server pouring leftover water from a bottle of water at another table into the emptier bottle from the table she was cleaning.  Then we witnessed the same practice a couple more times while we were eating so it was not a one-off situation.  It was gross in my opinion.

The fish was pretty fresh and would probably rate 3.5 stars.  The hot dishes were so-so.

It would be nice to be acknowledged and treated like you're happy to have customers as there are plenty of other restaurants to go to.
author: Bea Q.

description:
This hidden gem recently opened in the OMI (Oceanview Merced Heights Ingleside) District. Typically we don't have very many "fancy" restaurants on the Ocean corridor so it's a welcome addition to the neighborhood. The outside is nondescript but the inside is sleek and modern.

The highlight of the menu was definitely the rolls. We got the Kirin, Inside Out and 49er rolls. Each was fresh with the right amount of sushi rice tang and not heavily loaded sauce. The hamachi carpaccio was also light with the perfect amount of acidity.

I took one star off for the Robata. The grilled food (scallops, chicken skin, pork belly) was alright but pricey for the portion amount. Nothing stellar or any standouts.

Definitely get the fresh wasabi! Worth the $3.

Also there are two private rooms in back with a large table and private screen to watch sports games or sing karaoke. One note on karaoke - the screens throughout the restaurant show karaoke music so be prepared for loud (oftentimes bad) singing from other tables
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
I really want to like this place, and I think it has potential, however, there are some areas that require improvement. 

The core of this restaurants problems lie in its' expansive menu. Literally, every Japanese dish you can imagine is transcribed onto a two page menu. This takes away from the quality and thoughtfulness that can go into preparing a couple of dishes really well as apposed to a bunch of dishes mediocrely.

With that said, the sushi was subpar, though the nigiri was the exception because it was fresh. The sushi rice on the specialty rolls was hard, with a stale quality, and the seaweed was chewy and almost inedible on the complementary tuna roll. The real kicker came when I shoved a whole piece of unagi into my mouth and found myself chewing on pin bones. I really think if they cut down the size of the menu, a greater focus could be spent where it really matters. 

Another thing that should be worked on is the service. In a span of a couple of minutes, I was asked consecutively by FOUR different servers if I was ready to order after telling them I'm waiting on someone. I appreciate the attentiveness but it become pushy. There is clearly a lack of communication. With some work I do think this place can thrive.
author: Adriana G.

description: Love their happy hour menu: the Dynamite Mussels were probably my favorite but the spicy salmon roll and the spicy tuna tacos were also good too. The interior is very modern with dim lighting, and there's even karaoke rooms in case you want to bring a party. Solid place to go for sushi
author: Emily C.

description:
Wow! I am so glad to have found this place. I went for a friends birthday during happy hour and we ordered all of the dishes on the happy hour menu because they were all such a great deal. And honestly I would order them all again.

Oh, and did I mention this place has Karaoke? I don't know about you, but when I karaoke I love to have my own private room so my friends and I can be as embarrassing as we want and this is the type of karaoke Sakesan provides.
author: Sydney G.

description:
Talk about a downgrade on quality! I've ordered here before and it's one of the (now former) so so places to get sushi around the outer mission area. I order a tekka maki ($6) and spider roll ($10). In the past the spider rolls were huge! They even included the soft shell crab legs and everything. Now you can't even tell it's soft shell crab in it. It's all fake imitation crab. I was so disappointed. I instantly regret ordering from here. 

From what I've ordered in the past to now, I can tell that it's only downhill from here. I won't be ordering food from here any longer to save me the heartache and pain. I'd rather get sushi from the Whole Foods sushi bar which costs just as much but tastes better. 

I'll pass on this place from now on.
author: Marie N.

description: Took my parents here for dinner, and found the food and service just adequate. The staff was not very attentive, and it was a Tuesday night so not much foot traffic. Definitely prefer the Richmond location over this one. The interior is really modern and nice, though.
author: Daisy T.

description: 3.5 Star! Sakesan new location on Ocean that also has karaoke rooms and $1 oysters. I haven't been to this location but many times at their other location on clement. Today I ordered Togo at their new location on Ocean and sad to say it definitely need some work compare to clement. The soft shell crab was hard and dry, the unagi was burnt, the fried baby octopus wasn't all that and the lion king seems dry which usually it's moist. The escolar isn't the usual fresh white color and smaller than what I'm use to on clement. The good things was the other fishes was fresh . The regular uni assuming from Santa Barbara and Hokkaido uni was really good. The food experience didn't wow me but prob it's because it is Togo.  I will definitely try eating there and updating  my review later.
author: Christy V.

description: I've been to Japan and this place has sushi that reminds me of Japan. Its fresh and melts in your mouth. Can't wait to come back.
author: Jessica C.

description: Great for a group reserved room with a group of girlfriends for girls night out! Had an awesome time. The staff are very friendly and helpful.
author: Erika P.

description:
Good find in the Oceanview neighborhood! I'm pretty sure this is the first decent sushi spot in the area, so extra points for that. Modern atmosphere and high ceilings, letting in a lot of light to make for a nice dining experience. 

Ordered the Inside Out, Kirin, and Dragon Rolls. All were tasty and had reasonable prices for the portions. $14 each. Also ordered the sashimi combo and white wine -- these were overpriced and underwhelming comparative to the rolls. 

Service was OK. Seemed to just be "business", which is fine but more personable waiters would be nice!

Will come back again as this is close to home for me, and I can't not be a regular here for the sushi. :)
author: Jazzica D.

description:
Walking in, the place looked gorgeous. There is bar seating, communal seating, a couple of tables, and an area to dine in a more secluded area. 

We ordered the 8 pieces sashimi bowl, bacon wrapped asparagus skewers, chicken skin skewers, and pork belly skewers. The sashimi tasted fresh and came chilled on ice. My favorite of the skewers was the bacon wrapped asparagus. The bacon was crispy and the asparagus a little if the crunchy side (which I prefer). The chicken skin was crispy, light and seasoned perfectly. The pork belly fell a little short. It was under-seasoned and not at crispy as I would've liked. 

These skewers came two per order. It also came with a lemon wedge to squeeze on top. 

Our orders arrived promptly and water was refilled as soon as we could ask.
author: Joseph H.

description: Great modern and hip sushi spot! Happy hour from 4-6! We got a ton of food for two people under $50! Very fast service, tasty food, right rolls.
author: Kim M.

description: Awesome food! Love the lamb chops and nigori strawberry sake (cold). The sushi is good but I go to a lot of sushi bars so they're starting to taste the same.  The service is above average but not excellent. Overall, this place is new and still need more training (don't make customers wait too long for their bill to come, they just might take a flight on you).  There's no parking except on the street...we were here around 8:30 pm and it's still busy area.
author: Corazon F.

description:
My fiancée and I have been waiting for a trendy sushi spot to open up in our neighborhood. Thankfully Sakesan opened up and gave us a date night-worthy restaurant close to our home in Oceanview! I must admit that it was very interesting to suddenly see such a different crowd in our area, willing to brave a Mission-like hourlong wait. Luckily, we made a reservation!

Sakesan has a really modern design and atmosphere. They also have a wide variety of classic and house special maki. The portion sizes for the rolls also fit the pricing. I would recommend trying the Inside Out and Kirin.

I had to deduct a star for the sashimi being slightly overpriced ($18 for 8 tiny pieces) and for a very thin, uneventful wine list (2 reds and 2 whites only). But I'm pretty sure my fiancée and I will be coming back being that we're so close. I'm very hopeful that a couple of return visits to try other menu items like the robata and the sake (and the karaoke!) will prompt an update to this review.
author: Ryan M.

description: I've been here two times! It's the nicest restaurant to dine in on Ocean. Very pretty inside. Prices are reasonable. And the food is really yummy! We ordered the sea bass, poke dokey, fried squid, China's hi don, and green tea ice cream and matcha mochi. Everything was delicious. Made me realize that many places in a similar price range aren't very good. The total bill including sake and beer was only $75. No wait on a Thursday night.
author: Mighty B.

description:
I wanted to treat my friend out to eat and she craved sushi so we went sakesan! 

The interior is very nice very big the rooms go all the way to the back where the karaoke rooms are.

We were helped by Tiffany and she was very attentive patient and nice while our indecisive selfs were ordering our dinner. 

Dynamite mussels- delicious 10/10 I will eat again

Lion king- bomb idk why I always have to get lion king at every restaurant

Toro- it was my first time trying it because my friend wanted it and it was delicious 

Overall we had a great experience at sakesan and we'll be back again. We also got some gold flake sake and I would've taken a picture but my friend and I drank it ...
author: An L.

description:
4 of us went to dinner at this recently opened restaurant last September 15. 
The place was very impressive, from the high ceilings to the different "theme" rooms (tatami, karaoke, gen dining, bar) and even the restrooms!! The drinks were so varied and so was the menu. All priced reasonably (menu attached for your leisurely review). As Arnold S would say:"I'll be back". Special mention too to the super energetic staff especially to Jeff.
author: Jaime H.

description: I went for happy hour a few days ago and had a few things on their menu from the happy hour menu. The sauce they had for the gyoza this time wasn't the same as what I had the first time I went. I don't remember exactly what kind of sauce it was but wasn't the usual gyoza sauce. It was still good though. I also had the oyster shooter which I liked and very yummy. I had their $1 oysters from their menu and uni sashimi style. The uni was from Hokkaido, Japan, really fresh but really small tiny pieces(for $18). Always one of my favorite dishes to order from a Japanese restaurant. I also ordered chicken Karaage really crispy and tasty. Didn't taste dry at all. Also ordered 3 rolls from their happy hour menu. After all the food the bill came out to be about $62.00 with tip.
author: Jamie W.

description: This place is new, pricey and just ok. Only been once to check it out. Gotta plan in advance if you wanna get a group here to sing Karaoke. Date spot, I would think so. Feels pretty intimate.
author: Jray M.

description:
Thank you Sakesan for coming into my life

Such a great addition to the neighborhood! Kind staff great fresh fish!!!
author: Kelsey E.

description: Pretty good! Glad to see a decent sushi spot added to the neighborhood. A touch on the pricey side, but what sushi spot in SF isn't? Will definitely be coming back. Get the jalapeño poppers!
author: Ren B.

description: Came here on a Tuesday for their night HH and it was pretty bomb! I'll definitely be back again and again. I can't wait to explore more of their menu!
author: Julianne O.

description:
I love coming here - with my family, my friends, & my boo! The wait is reasonable and the staff is always so accommodating. They have lots of gluten-free and vegan friendly items here as well.

Must Try if You Can:
-Raw Oysters ($1 Fresh Oysters)
-Jalapeño Poppers
-Hamachi Kama (super juicy)
-8pc Omakase Nigiri *** Special of the day

The fish here is very fresh and all the nigiris that I have ordered have melted in my mouth. They also have a large list of sake for those of you who like to sip and eat! 

This is one of my new favorite places in the neighborhood to go to and I'm sure once you try it
author: Melissa C.

description:
If you like the original restaurant in the Richmond District, you will be sure to love this new location on Ocean Avenue!

Once you walk inside the restaurant, it has a very upscale vibe to it, which definitely matches the interior design of the place. 

They have a great selection of fresh fish and also an extensive menu of grilled options.

Some of my favorite dishes of the night include:
Fresh Oysters
Hamachi Carpaccio 
Agedashi Tofu 
Geso Karaage 
Butabara 
Yakitori

This place is perfect for a date night or a great place to have a family dinner at the Tatami section.
author: Lydia L.

description: My friends and I had dinner and the food did not disappoint.  Everything was beautifully presented.  The wait staff were courteous and friendly. Nice selection on the menu but don't expect bento boxes.  It's not that kind of restaurant.  The dishes are small and a bit pricey.  The place can get crowded so reservations are highly recommended.  If your party is large enough, there's a private room. Conversations are hard because it gets loud plus there are TV screens playing music videos.
author: Isabella G.

description: Love $ 1 dollar oyster & happy hour menu. Don't forget to check out the restroom!
author: Thomas N.

description: I've eaten at front tables twice and ordered take out. I love their seafood soups! Food has been very good but service not so much. The waitresses give attitude.
author: Christel B.

description:
I went here at dinner time on Monday, Memorial Day, with my boyfriend to celebrate with our 2 year anniversary here. 

The server sat us at a bar seat and before I could ask if it was possible to wait a little longer for a table to open up, she had already walked away.  So we just accepted our fate and sat there.  
We had also come here specially for oysters but they had run out by dinner time.  

Our server had also never served us our plates, utensils or anything.. so when the food came out we had to just sit and stare at the food until the waitress finally noticed our raised hand. 

Another thing is that we had spilled some water on our table and it kept dripping water on our laps when we lifted our tiny cups to drink. It was so uncomfortable.  We finally got napkins way later and then was able to wipe up the water but then had no napkins for the rest of the meal.  


Food wise, we ordered rolls and some skewers.  The rolls were pretty good! Flavor wise, I enjoyed it a lot.  However, the rice was kinda dry.  A little sip of water was needed to swallow it.  
However, I did not enjoy the skewers I ordered.  I got the beef tongue and chicken hearts.  The beef tongue pieces were thick and personally really really felt like I was chewing an actual tongue/making out with a cow.  My boyfriend and I could not stomach it.  Chicken hearts were alright, but did not enjoy the flavors. (Side note: chicken hearts and beef tongue are my favorites which is why I ordered these skewers in the first place. )

The whole time we were there we felt highly unwelcome and ignored by our server and when she did interact with us it was very short and curt.  

My boyfriend and I felt so uncomfortable by the whole dining experience so we left early instead of ordering more, which is disappointing because I had really waited forever to finally get a chance to try this place out. 

The ambience of this place was nice and bustling though. 

Also, in case y'all were wondering, I still tipped decently (19% in cash) even though the service was shitty and ruined our anniversary dinner date.
author: Daisy S.

description: A humble review of a vegetarian- The food was really good and tasty. Ordered potato croquette, mango roll , and Veggie curry rice. Worth the visit and looking forward to visit again.
author: Prateek R.

description:
Sakesan is the best thing (minus my business haha) that has happened to this neighborhood! There are so many amazing things about this restaurant - I'll try my best listing them all (you all should really read my review as I absolutely love coming here)!

My mom, fiancé and I literally stalked this place while it was being built out. We couldn't believe Sakesan was coming to my neighborhood (we used to go to the Clement location)! 

Here's what make this place:
- The owner and staff. Barry, the owner, is awesome! No matter how busy this place gets, he always have a huge grin on his face and is continuously running around making sure all of his guests are happily taken care of. The sushi chefs and manager are also great. Thanks for taking such great care of us. 
- the happy hour (from 4pm-6pm daily) is ridiculously awesome. Try the tuna poke tacos and stock up on the $5 large sakes
- the freshness of the food is also amazing. We have dined here so many times (and brought so many of my friends) and everyone has always been delighted with the food
- try the fresh wasabi. Totally worth the $3. It'll give your food even more amazing flavor
- the separate karaoke rooms are a blast and they'll even let you turn on your favorite sports team 
- they take reservations on yelp and always honor them 
- they are kid friendly! I have a daycare and many of my family have gone there and have raved about this place too
- their grilled items and soups are delicious. Give them a try too. I love their sukiyaki soup. Perfect for a cold San Francisco day, with a side of hot sake 

I can go on and on about how awesome this Japanese restaurant is but honestly, the best part of it is the ambiance. We can sit here for hours and just feel so happy and relaxed. Perhaps it's the tall ceilings and overall Feng shui or perhaps it's just the fun vibe. Regardless, this place deserves more than 5 stars and I can't wait to go back!
author: Anastasia N.

description: The worst "omakase" I've ever had. Not only was the fish not good, chef gives me the cheapest fish. So much for "chef's choice". Even a chirashi bowl at a decent sushi restaurant is better than this $30 omakase.
author: C Y.

description:
First of all.....if you have a last call of 30 minutes before your restaurant closes (12am) you should definitely let that be known. We ubered here and were here at 11:35 and they wouldn't seat us as they said there was a "last call" of 11:30. 

It should be posted somewhere so customers know not to come here hoping they would make it before closing time which is 12am according to Yelp.
author: Maria P.

description:
Lack of service !!! The staff have no attention !! After we asked for check. It takes us like 15 Mins!!! 
The food is average. Nothing is memorable. Just the average sushi place.
author: Teerawat S.

description:
Just came into this new spot with a few friends yesterday night. Still pretty packed for a Thursday at 9pm, but got seated at the island table area real quick. There's a mix of tables, a sushi bar, and rooms where you take off your shoes and sit down. Nice ambiance and great date place/hang out with friends. 

Overall, solid place and good price for sushi in Ingleside. We ordered the $1 oysters, which were really good and tiny. They were fresh and we ended up ordering 3 dozens. I would definitely come back for the oysters!

We also ordered the Gambler Roll and Cherry Blossom roll. The gambler definitely is IG worthy, they put 151 in the middle of the dish and light it on fire. One of the pieces out of eight are SUPER spicy and luckily i didn't get it! My friend said the spice lasted a long time, but it was really good. The rolls were solid and nothing too special, but the ingredients were definitely fresh.

The sashimi selection of 35 pieces for $64(?) and I would say that was the most disappointing. The fish were overall fresh, but the way they displayed it on ice (although looks really good), made some pieces of the sashimi really cold and more wet? If they can find a way to display the fish, but keep the sashimi not all tasting a different temperature, that would be great. That was just one thing I thought could really be improved.

I would not get sashimi by itself next time, but most likely try the omakase nigiri (10 pieces) to see the chef's selection and decide about sashimi from there.

Overall, solid and great service. There's also a TV so a good place to watch the game at. I would come back again and also want to try out their Karaoke room! There's a $250 minimum spent for their room, so gather your friends for some drinks and sushi and sing your heart out together :)
author: Josie L.

description: California rolls were good. Staff was friendly and service was amazing. I look forward to returning soon.
author: J W.

description:
Probably the worst service I've ever seen. Had to stop eating and personally track down the waitress (who was either wandering around or chatting with others) whenever we need anything. In the end, when we asked for the check, she came back ten minutes later with a check that has a big circle around the 'tip' section on the check. Seriously? 

Would have given this place 3.5 stars for the food (fish is fresh, but the flavor of the sushi rice is off), 2 stars for the vibe (what's the deal with all the karaoke screens and the 90s karaoke music?), but I do not recommend this place for anyone.
author: Eve M.

description: My new favorite go-to sushi place! Sashimi and sushi are extremely melt-in-your mouth fresh. Sushi rolls are large and filling. I highly recommend the toro carpaccio and hamachi kama. Prices are very reasonable! They also have karaoke rooms until the back for large parties. Must try!
author: Jenny N.

description: This place is near SFSU! What caught my attention is the two different timings for happy hour! It's great for students who are craving sushi and some drinks when it's late and on a budget! One thing I would say is that they should have more sushi and rolls options on the their happy hour! The staff is great and super friendly! The place is clean!
author: Mubaraka M.

description:
I came here during the soft opening, I was pretty happy with the results. I got a bit of nigiri and some of their other dishes, solid.
The Raw Octopus is delicious.
The robata was totally how I liked it and reasonably priced!
Writing this review I'm feeling a bit hungry for some more right now.
author: Tom S.

description: This is NOT a celiac disease friendly place. I asked the waitress about a few things on the menu - miso, etc - and ended up ordering two rolls that she assured me were gluten free. She came back though and wanted to make sure wheat was okay, because their sushi rice has wheat in it. I ended up with an assortment of raw oysters, sauceless chicken skewer, and sashimi. Also, my green tea never came, and I'm pretty sure the whole staff thought I was insane. I definitely wouldn't go back, because after them thinking vinegar wasn't ok for me but wheat was ok, I don't think they (at lest three staff helped) understand what gluten is.
author: B J.

description:
So glad this spot opened up in the neighborhood. Finally a late night spot you actually want to go on this side of the city.

The Hand Rolls and Unagi are Great!
author: Korvus L.

description: HAPPY HOUR FOR $4 and up; a pitcher for $11 Sapporo. Bathroom is unisex, and everyone has an awesome attitude. My friend and I randomly pulled up to use their restroom but they recommended their happy hour and we decided to stayed longer and enjoyed being there. I will be back!
author: Mimi B.

description: I'm soooooo excited that this place open closer to my friends house.. literally walking distance to all day everyday $1 oysters... YES YOU HEARD IT RIGHT! ALL DAY EVERY DAY EVERY HOUR DOLLAR OYSTERS. Two happy hours as well!!
author: Whitney N.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with a group of 6 and we booked out one of their two karaoke rooms in the back. First thing, walking into the restaurant, it was very cozy with a nice modern vibe (also check out their cool unisex bathroom area) -- overall, I really liked how they designed the place.

Food - AHHMAZING...we tried a lot of dishes but I would have to say my favorites were the oysters and the sashimi, which was very fresh. Combining that with their freshly chopped wasabi was the way to go! I put that wasabi basically on everything, it's got such a great kick. I also really enjoyed the Kirin roll which consisted of the BBQ eel.

Karaoke - thank goodness the rooms were roughly soundproof bc with a bit of beer and endless song selection, I sincerely apologize for my inevitable off key singing...

Service - the waitresses were very attentive and friendly....solid service.

I'm definitely planning on coming back soon, one of the better sushi joints I've had in a while.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Ambiance, food selections and qualities, cleanliness, decoration, noise level, customer services are all above average. The only point taken is for parking.. After 9:00 they don't take reservations. Walk-in only (wait in line)
author: Heather K.

description:
Went to their soft opening for dinner as a party of three. We ordered their tako wasabi, ankimo, jalapeno poppers, seafood yosenabe, ramu yaki, hamachi kama, asari sakamushi, robata hotate, and gyutan. 

All of the dishes were solid and I would reorder any of them the next time I visit. However, the dishes that really stood out to me were:

Ramu yaki: it was cooked a perfect medium rare and super juicy. It does sadly come in only two pieces, but imo it's worth at least trying once.

Hamachi kama: super tender and grilled well

Ankimo: 5 pieces and it's quality was comparable to the one from Izakaya kou imo.

Tako wasabi: this is one of my go to orders and I liked the addition of caviar to it here.

Service was solid, they were understaffed for the soft opening so I'm expecting it to improve over time.

This is one of the few places on this side of Ocean Ave I would suggest to people that it's actually worth driving out here for.
author: Eric L.

description:
We frequently come to Sakesan for Friday night sushi. The place gets really busy so consider going earlier or later in the evening with a smaller party. 

The tables are all different with some requiring you to take your shoes off before entering.

The menu has a wide variety and high quality seafood. So glad it opened in our neighborhood.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: We order the soup with oyster and Mushroom,  Beef stuffed asparagus, The dragon roll, OMG roll and salmon tacos , 12  oysters , House sake.  This is my new favorite place everything was so good. The service was great I definitely will be back to try to deep fried oysters and so much more.
author: Honey H.

description: The food and service was great. It was a noisy. From another table nearby which made it hard to hear. Definitely will come back for the food. Very fresh. Seaweed salad was a little sweet which made it interesting to enjoy. The albacore tacos were fresh. Swamp roll was fresh roll. It's a little pricey for this area.
author: Andy L.

description: Thank you for opening a decent Japanese option on Ocean Avenue with a wide variety of dishes! The space here is beautiful and the service is super attentive. Food is pretty decent too - we had some nigiri, a few rolls, robata and some hot dishes.
author: Kyle D.

description: Good, great, clean, helpful, and modern. Love this new restaurant in the area that offers great food at affordable prices.
author: Nilu S.

description:
My boyfriend and I have frequented this spot since the opening - mainly since we live down the street. The service is great, the food is good, the vibe is a good time - I would definitely host a group dinner and karaoke here. However, after ordering takeout via Uber eats a few times - I don't think we will be returning. We ALWAYS receive smaller portions when we get takeout. 

Tonight I ordered 2 miso soup, Phoenix roll, 2 orders of salmon belly sashimi and tempura moriawase. We've ordered the same items previously for dining at the restaurant. The takeout received looked nothing like what is usually prepared. The Phoenix roll was smaller in size and had only one slice of avocado on one piece. The tempura did not come with sauce on the side. For $60, I'm disappointed. 

I'm sure it's easy to skim portions on takeout since the customers can't return an order or typically request a refund after an order - but this is just really disappointing that it keeps happening. We really wanted to make this our weekly spot but unless this is addressed, we won't be returning.
author: Shelby L.

description:
Wow - on Ocean Avenue no less!
This place is off the hook. I have eaten sushi all over the city and Sakesan is amazing. We sampled a lot of different things, the beef don, the nigiri maguro and hamachi, the golden gate roll, the spider roll, uni, and oh those oysters! Everything is super fresh and tasty. I can't wait to try the happy hour. If you are super hungry be prepared to spend some serious money. If you just want a simple meal, they have that too and it won't cost you an arm and a leg  - but you have to resist the temptation of vast and amazing menu. I'm going to go back again and again to figure out my fav's. A dangerous plan. I can't wait!
author: Debbie B.

description: Excellent service and overall a great experience for my mom's birthday. The quality is up to my standards. Mostly I am giving a good review because of the price bias.
author: Ho O.

description:
Let's start with what I like.

* Restrooms are all singles. And they're all "All Gender". Beautiful.
* There's no paper towels in the restrooms, only hand dryers. Great, save the environment.
* Food was great. They even serve fresh wasabi at the price of $3. Unfortunately, the fresh wasabi is mixed with green onions and garlic, and it looks very liquid. Other than that, it definitely tastes like real wasabi.
* We got a floor table, but it's not really "floor". You'd have to take your shoes off (fantastic, love this), and they have space for you to put your feet down, so you actually feel like sitting on a chair. You don't have to cross your legs. I don't know how to best describe this, but yeah, I hope you get what I meant.
* The hot green tea was good, but it's $1 per person. It's a good green tea though.
* The Lion King (I think that's the baked salmon?) was great.
* The chicken karaage is a bit different. It's in small pieces, but they're good.

Now, let's talk about what I don't like (or I hope would change):

* The sink for hand washing would be better with sensors. When I went there, one of them was still running and no one was there. Such a waste of water.
* For the skewers, they should put the number of skewers that you'd get. I ordered "2 Yakitori" and "3 Kawa (Chicken Skin)". What I got was 4 skewers of yakitori and 6 skewers of chicken skin. We still ate them all, but on the menu, there are some items that end with "... (2 pcs)". Hence, I assumed that the ones without that would only be 1 piece. The server told us that each skewer order comes with 2 pcs. So, why would some menu have explicit "(2 pcs)" on it?
* The chicken skin skewer is also very crispy, which I don't like very much. I like the skin to be soft. So, if you like super crispy skin, you'd definitely like this.
* I was expecting the standard oyako donburi would be served, but they don't serve that. They serve other things like curry donburi or bbq eel. 
* I would love them to also have katsu curry though, I would definitely come there to get to-go order if they do (along with oyako donburi).


Overall, I'd definitely come back to this place. It's nice to have a "high-end" feeling restaurant like this on Ocean Ave! This place is definitely the nicest there is around the area.
author: Ardo K.

description:
Got sat at the sushi bar. Beautiful place , bar is nice and seats are nice. Took a little while for server to come to us but it was understandable, it was kind of busy. 

Staff is super nice , sushi chefs were cool, servers were cool, they cleaned our empty plates right away. 

Ordered sushi and robata. 

The sake is farm raised, it was ok. Not too much flavor. 

Maguro was great.

Ebi was good

Do not order the ikura. The eggs were either frozen still, or old. They were hard and got stuck between my teeth. 

The seaweed wrap was not good, it was too cold, so it was mushy. 

Got the bbq calamari. Undercooked, and not cleaned in the center. It was pretty bad. That's actually what killed our buzz, we ended up leaving after that. 

Overall, everyone was super cool, and the fish was pretty good. 

Willing to come back again but not any time soon.
author: Igor T.

description:
Food is ok for the price ur not getting great fish 
The interior is very nice but their are big screen TVs every where 
Real restaurants don't have tv s ! And even the guys that are making the sushi can't stop watching it 
Annoying 
The price reflects the food n place not a high end sushi please but good enough for a hook that desperately needs a sushi Resturant
author: Paula O.

description: Love this place!  Very fresh fish and reasonable price. Interior space is very hip and modern. Service was very friendly and attentive. Cheers!
author: EunJoo C.

description: We have eaten here two times now and love the addition to the neighborhood. I'm expecting and can't eat sushi, so the happy hour is perfect for us. My husband could get a 4 piece spicy tuna roll and a tuna taco, while I enjoyed the udon, gyozas, and tempura to share. We also had a tempura banana and black sesame ice cream for dessert--yum! I turned to him and said, "this is the best fried banana I have ever had." I've been craving their udon, so we will definitely be back. Service is speedy and everything is clean. I'm so happy something new came to Ingleside.
author: Brandi L.

description: Meh... its ok .. Nice dinning room , and sushi bar .. but the service is so bad its not even funny .. They make you wait around for water and wasabi and things that usually come to you within a min or two at any other sushi bar . The sushi was ok .. the skewers are crap ! Might come back for their happy hour
author: Micah W.

description: Reserved a karaoke room for my 21st and the service & food was unmatched by any other sushi restaurant I've ever gone to in SF. Super modern and new, service is kind and very attentive. I didn't have to wait too long for my order either. Definitely recommend either just for the food itself or if you're looking to down a few sake bombs with friends in a karaoke battle.
author: Taylor N.

description: OMG everything at this place is so freaking good!! Tried this place out for the first time after it was recently opened and me and my cousin loved it so much. We ordered 4 robata, 2 rolls, deep fried squid and half dozen oyster (not everything is in the pictue because we couldn't wait lol) and the bill come out to be only $58! The price is soooo reasonable! They have $1 oyster ALL DAY EVERYDAY. This alone can keep me coming back here again and again. Their robata is DA BOMB, the meat was perfectly seasoned, good portion for a good price. Sushi rolls were on point too, fish was fresh and all the ingredients put together tasted absolutely delicious. I also really like the modern yet sophisticated design of the restaurant, they use Japanese wine bottles as decoration. They have various items on the menu, raging from udon to rice bowl to sushi. I will definitely come back here to try out other dishes and introduce this new gem in the neighborhood to my friends! I hope they will keep up the superb quality and friendly customer service :)
author: Bao Q.

description: Love this place. What a great find. Found on yelp one afternoon and made reservations for 7:15 the same night. We were seated immediately when we arrived and our server was with us shortly after. We ordered lots of sake and lots of food; small plates made it easy for our group to share and try lots of different things. We started with some yummy oyster shooters and then moved on to food. The menu is large and no doubt serves a variety of tastes. All of the rolls we tried were delicious and fresh, we loved the OMG, lion king, lobster, and super dynamite roll (the latter probably being our favorite). We also tried the negima (another favorite), chicken skin, beef tongue, scallops, and the kake miso (all very delicious and flavorful). Overall great food, chic atmosphere, and friendly service! We will definitely be coming back, Sakesan is a new favorite place for us!
author: Kaylee D.

description: We ordered the $60 premium omakase. They gave us all the cheap fishes (3 kinds of salmons). It's definitely NOT worth it. The other stuffs were ok, nothing too impressive.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Don't go here! Horrible horrible service. Skimpy portions. Ordered sushi and curry. The waitress had no idea what fish was in a dish. There was a bug on the table. Got a dirty dish. Got the sushi but 30 mins after getting the sushi had still not gotten the curry. We asked them to remove that item and left. The food we did get was decent. I saw a couple bad reviews but still had to check it out to see. Will never be back.
author: Andrea R.

description: Ooooh man. THANK YOU FOR OPENING JUST DOWN THE HILL FROM MY HOUSE. I love you. This place is delicious, I loved the shoes off seating area. The Toro sashimi was perfect. We also had salmon, yellow tail and uni and it was wonderful.
author: Tanya T.

description: I have eaten here several times now. The food is consistently good, however, the service will be what eventually kills this restaurant. There always seems to be one dish that gets forgotten. Tonight we waited close to 20 minutes after we had finished all our other food for an order of 3 chicken wings. We reminded our servers a couple of times that we were waiting. We finally asked for our check and to forget the wings. They arrived at our table 30 seconds later. A frustrating way to end an otherwise good meal. While the staff is friendly and seemingly means well, they can't quite seem to get it all together.
author: Peter O.

description: Everything was perfect, great service, great people. They always were on task. We ate everything. Good prices, I couldn't complain
author: Timothy S.

description:
The Hamachi Kama was very tasty.  The fried squid was over battered and tastes fishy.
I would come back!
author: Sandi W.

description:
I love sushi. This is a good, fresh sushi...Yummy!
A little over priced, but I will go there again.
author: Y K.

description: Curry beef over rice with mixed veggies and potatoes was decisions. Just the right balance of mild Japanese curry sauce over rice and veggies. Definitely a dish worth eating again. Fried chicken was light and tasty. Moist and tender. Pork belly on skewers were a surprise. Not greasy and the meat was grilled to stay moist and tender. It is great to see this new restaurant opened until midnight on Ocean Avenue. Highly recommended!
author: Gary G.

description: This place claims to be open until midnight, uber'ed pretty far to show up at 11:34pm. The helpless hostess said their last call was at 11:30pm. How the fork am I supposed to know you do not serve past 11:30pm when your closing time is midnight????? I suggest you help hungry cranky people out and post this on your yelp page or outside your door, thank you!!!!!!!
author: Ana C.

description:
LOVE this place!! First of all the Staffs are very friendly, professional and accommodating.  The quality and freshness of their food, especially the sushi/sashimi is spot on!  The prices are little high but all worth it as they are not skimpy with their ingredients in their Sushi, cooked and Izakaya entree..Just Wonderful!!  The best part as the name of the restaurant suggest is the selection of their Sake, it is REALLY NICE!  I personally have expansive appreciation for Sake and I must admit they cut no corners with their selections.  I'm glad they opened this one in the Sunset District as I live close by but I still visit their sister place in the Richmond district on Clement which is the first Sakesan Bistro.  I hope and wish everyone can enjoy and experience the food and Sake to compliment as I have.
          "Kampai"
author: Thomas H.

description: Sakesan is a great addition to the neighborhood. The food is reasonably priced and the slices of fish are thick and cut generously. Try the gambler roll where one piece is discreetly spicier than the others. They have private rooms in the back that are great for larger parties. They take reservations which is always a plus.
author: Lester W.

description: The sashimi is skimpy. Paid $5 for two pieces of nothing. The quality of the fish was average. It just wasn't worth the price. I ordered delivery through Grubhub. I was very disappointed.
author: Dakshina T.

description: I was finally able to try Sakesan this past week and I am a big fan. The decor is beautiful and they have a great ambiance. They have a wide variety of Japanese eats. My favorite was the salmon skin hand roll and the salmon don. I can't wait to try out their other menu items and I will definitely be back.
author: Linda L.

description: Really wanted to try this tonight. Our Neighborhood has had the benefit of new places to eat and this certainly seemed like a new edition that is right up our culinary alley. Unfortunately, they could not (would not) accommodate my wife; who has a condition which does not allow her to have the acid in the prepared sushi rice, by making her sushi without the added vinegar. It's too bad. One would think they make rice all day long. Other places, including a sister restaurant to this one was perfectly fine with that accommodation. It pretty much ruined a simple night out.
author: Steve R.

description: One of the best sushi places I've been in town and definitely the best restaurant in the area, recommend the Toro, Hamachi Belly, and Salmon Belly nigiri.
author: Samir S.

description: Went there for happy hour on Tuesday around 5pm.  First time being there.  Service was excellent and friendly.   $1 Oysters were not fresh!   Luckily, ordered only 6.   They have a few options, but I think Happy hour prices are OK and tastes alright.  Other sushi roles are $12-$15 range, but decided not to try if oysters weren't fresh.   For the service, I gave 3-star.  Otherwise, 2-star
author: Stanley L.

description: This was the best sushi I have ever had!! The fish was so fresh and tasty and it was real Japanese style by Japanese!
author: Misgana M.

description: Went here for Happy Hour during the soft opening and the food was good enough to eat a complete dinner! They have plenty of vegetarian options, though no veggie sushi on the happy hour menu or veggie gyoza anywhere, which seems like an oversight. Prices are generally quite fair as are portion sizes. The service was excellent and the restaurant is beautifully designed. Will be back!
author: B C.

description: I usually never order takeout/delivery when it comes to sushi (picky), I feel it's more of a cleaner and fresher presentation in the restaurant but my son and I had such a big craving for sushi this night. We saw the ratings and decided to go for it, ordering was easy since they had the online ordering menu and we ended up ordering a big assortment of dishes which included of course sushi rolls, no nigiri sushi (I'm VERY picky). The delivery arrived quickly considering we lived at least 15-20 minutes away by car, containers and presentation was excellent. Food was delicious and tasted fresh.  I would definitely order takeout/delivery from this restaurant again!
author: Maxie P.

description: Excellent new sushi place in the neighborhood. I've been waiting for a good sushi place to open up nearby and this place did not disappoint. We finally decided to try this new place out and made a reservation online for 6:45. Definitely make a reservation because when we left a lot of people were waiting to be seated. First of all, the menu is extensive and offers everything you could possibly want! We tried a lot of different items on the menu and I really went there to try the Robata items. We had half a dozen oysters which was just $1 each! Such a steal. It was good but definitely not as good as other seafood restaurants. We also had the tempura basket($13), sake sashimi, sake sushi, salmon roe, New York roll, Philly roll, dragon roll, baby abalone, gyutan (beef tongue), and beef with asparagus skewers. The abalone ($12) was delicious but you only get one skewer (2 pieces) for that. The rest came with two skewers. The beef tongue was tasty, had a great texture and sauce for it. The sake was sooo fresh and delicious, I couldn't stop complimenting it to my boyfriend. My boyfriend doesn't even like raw fish and he even said it was good! All the sushi was super fresh and definitely worth the try. They're all for a good piece as well. We definitely got a lot of food for two but we really wanted to see what this restaurant was about and we were definitely not disappointed. Also, we found out at dinner that they also have karaoke in the back. Apparently they have two rooms in the back and you have to request it with the staff for day and hours/ rate. Overall, definitely a must try for foodies!
author: Rachel M.

description: Second time here and it was great! Love having it in the neighborhood! Both the rolls and the hot plates are good! It gets busy so if you're coming during a prime hour you may want to reserve a spot. My roommate and I ate at the bar. We've decided to become regulars.
author: Kali S.

description: Great quality and nice place for the neighborhood.  Fresh fish and cheap beer.  There are cute tables sunk into the floor / private rooms / and bar seating.
author: Max G.

description: After driving around the crowded neighborhood for 15 minutes, we finally found parking. We were seated at a hightop table and the order was taken fairly quickly. After waiting for more than 45 minutes, I thought the kitchen might be backed up as it was quite crowded. When the two gentlemen next to me received all of their four orders immediately even though they arrived a half hour behind us, I knew something was amiss. I asked another waitress if our order was coming as we had been waiting quite a while; she said "it's coming soon". In 5 minutes, the appetizer tuna tartare tacos (very good) arrived. We waited another 10 minutes and the waitress asked "did you order anything else?" and we said "yes, 5 sushi rolls." Part of our order (dragon rolls) came 10 minutes later. I asked where my spider roll was, and the waitress looked confused. Ten minutes later, my order came from a male server with our waitress nowhere to be seen. The bill arrived with no comps nor any explanation of the screwup, to my dissatisfaction. Though the food was good, the service was awful. It seems they favor Asian clientele over others. It will be a long time until I go back.
author: Michelle O.

description: This is my third time to eat in this sushi place. Every time we came here as a group of 4 - 8 people. I still remember the first time I came was very impressed. We came here the second day of their grand opening. This place was already full house and we are on the wait list and wait for about 30mins. The staff brought us to the center high table. After we ordered the food and another staff came to offer us to sit at a big tatami table because she saw us had a group of 8 people. That was very nice even they were busy but still care about customers. This place is so beautiful also the sushi and fried foods are fresh and tasty!
author: Yiu Kwan W.

description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood.  Great vibe, and really friendly and attentive staff.  Fish was fresh, too.  Only thing, and it is small, is that it took the server a good 10 or more minutes to let us know that they were out of a fish-type.  Other than that, I wish nothing but incredible success in what looks like a very significant capital expenditure.  It's a gorgeous interior and decor.  They've gotta sell some sushi, for sure.  Check it out.
author: Susie S.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood Sakesan. Friendly service. Lots of options on the menu. Good option for a late night dinner. Although on the pricey side, unfortunately.
author: Heather R.

description:
Went to their opening night on 4/27. 
Atmosphere:  high ceilings, wood beams and dark walls give it a modern feel. Girly pop music was a bit incongruous. 
Food:  happy hour menu had enough selections to make a light dinner. Regular menu had plenty of sushi and non sushi items. The special rolls were what you would find at any decent sushi establishment, but the fish itself was fresh, tender, tasty. Nigiri had some less common options like black snapper and striped bass. 
Drinks:  small selection for happy hour but decent prices. Otherwise, there was a sake list with explanations and tasting notes for those like me who require tutelage. 
Service:  attentive and helpful, but then again they were not very busy at all.   Definitely worth checking out.
author: Andrea K.

description: The food was excellent! Been to the one on Clement, but the energy here was so much cooler.  The servers were wonderful and attentive, especially Alyssa.  I highly recommend this spot as the next go-to in the Ocean Ave area!
author: Tra T.

description:
Great addition to Ocean Ave. Got sushi here with a few friends. The environment and food is great.

We bought the gambler roll though and it was very obvious which piece of sushi was spicy. Try to make it more discrete!
author: Hunter C.

description: I used to always go to the clement location but I'm so glad that they've opened this second location closer to home! Just as always it's just as great! The decor is so beautiful. It has a modern Japanese design with tatamis, sushi bar, tables, and karaoke rooms. It definitely has a warm-homey feeling especially from all the nice and sweet staff. All the staff is very attentive and efficient. They always make sure everything is on point!!! As for food, you must try the hamachi Kama and raiders roll. My all time favorites but everything else is still fresh and tasty as the other location. They also have a large selection of premium sakes which is a fun addition to your dinner ;) I will always be coming back!!!
author: Michelle C.

description: Love this new spot on Ocean Ave. A nice gem adding to this awesome neighborhood.  What I love is the two happy hours.  Price is amazing.  Can't go wrong with the happy hours.  Came here several times for regular dinner and always had a good time.  The staffs are friendly and always had good recommendations.  The $1 oyster is amazing.  Hope it never goes away.  Love eating while watching the music videos.  They always played good songs.  The karaoke room looks fun.  Have to try it soon for a birthday or celebration.  The decor is very modern.  Highly recommend this place to everyone.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Ok so this place is for sure my new favorite Japanese restaurant in San Francisco. I'me a huge food critic and super judgmental when it comes to good food in general. Hands down this place is great!  It's so beautifully decorated inside and has a fun atmosphere. They offer an awesome happy hour menu. Go check it out! Guarantee a great spot.
author: Michelle T.

description: Really fresh sushi. Music videos made the atmosphere a little weird but overall this sucji was really good.
author: Ashleigh V.

description: Great ambiance, thoughtful menu, great services (waitresses seemed very experienced given the restaurant only opened less than 2 months), reasonable price for most items. Good discount happy hour menu, many sake choices and food to pair with. What more can I say. I will definitely go back as i haven't tried their 1 dollar raw oyster.
author: Derrick L.

description: Most excellent experience.  Very large menu - both sushi lovers and non sushi lovers will have plenty of options (as will vegetarians). We had a variety of grilled items - the lamb chops were very flavorful and served piping hot. The asparagus was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The gyoza was some of the best I've ever had. I don't love the TVs but the atmosphere is hip and fun. The decor is gorgeous with high ceilings. Service was friendly.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Awesome spot that was much needed on ocean ave. The food was outstanding and fresh. Service was top notch. I went with a group of ten people total so we utilized their karaoke room. My group drank a lot and got a little wild and they managed us very well. Shout out to Ashley the manager who holds that place down. Great zero confusion sake list. The beer is on point and def dive into those oyster shooters!
author: Miles D.

description: The food continues to improved since their opening, however their service is taking a consistent nosedive. It took nearly an hour for them to check on the food and discover that one dish after a second try had failed to come out, and not even a basic apology for the wait. Also even beyond that one, dishes for a three top come out at very different times. hopefully now that the taste is pretty solid they'll work on their service training.
author: Bill W.

description: We really wanted to like this place! It's only a few blocks from our house, we were excited when it opened up a few months ago. When we made it in, we were tragically disappointed. We were seated after a short wait, ordered a bottle of wine and food. The food took over an hour, and we finished the entire bottle before seeing even our appetizer. After 45 minutes we began asking our server for an update, she checked with the kitchen and said 5-10 minutes longer. After the 10 minutes, she literally began avoiding us to keep us from inquiring further. She avoided our table the rest of the time we were there. Then she began serving the table next to us plate after plate, total of 8 dishes, they were a larger party.That party was seated a full half hour after us, so I knew our server must have lost our order or something. Anyhow, after 1 hour and 15 we had to flag a server from another table to close out our check and cancel whatever food was at the end of the queue. The good news is that the wine was good!
author: Ted J.

description: Phenomenal vibe and great food. The happy hour menu is well balanced and offers quite a few options. Def one of our new "go to" spots.
author: Tim B.

description: I live off of Ocean Avenue and was really thrilled to see a cool Sushi place open.. let me say I was extremely disappointed all around. The waitress seemed to not acknowledge us, the miso was very cold and I had to send it back and I found the portion of fish extremely skimpy. If you don't mind blaring music while you eat..then maybe you will be entertained .. the decor is beautiful.. but I will not be going back and I don't recommend you try this place..
author: Stacy I.

description: I have tried many Japanese restaurant in SF whether Kingza or in Richmond district.   This is below average, the quality compare others, is not even good.   Less tasty, because it's closed to my house.   Thats why I give it a try.   The Oyster was smaller like my thumb.   Not worth to pay the cost from the menu.   I rather go Kingza
author: Hanns C.

description: Went to try this for the first time. Nice environment. We were seated relatively quickly. I have an illness that prevents me from eating Sushi rice (can't have vinegar). Upon being seated I was told hey could accommodate this, so I happily pick some rolls to order. I'm then told they cannot accommodate me. Their menu is quite extensive but by then I was in the mood for sushi. I've been to many places that have no problem accommodating my needs. I'm very disappointed that they would not and we ended up walking out.
author: Kara R.

description: Checking out the new Sushi joint on Ocean Ave, and very happy indeed!  Great selection of sakes, and wide range of dishes.  Our favorite was the Deluxe California roll - real crab and man, you can taste the difference.  I loved the Dragon roll.  Miso soup was very delicately flavored.   Will definitively become a regular here.
author: Vanessa H.
